message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to each of these 10 statements about AI in education as if I'm a primary or secondary school teacher from the United States. I should consider practical classroom experience and reasonable perspectives on both the benefits and risks of AI.

Let me think through each one:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a reasonable positive use case. Many teachers could use AI assistance for brainstorming and drafting lesson plans. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is a reasonable capability that AI could provide through personalized learning. "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is a plausible use case for tutoring or personalized feedback. "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual learners, special education needs) - AI could help with translation, text-to-speech, adapted materials. This is promising. "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is definitely feasible and desirable. Teachers spend lots of time on grading, attendance, etc. "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern with AI tools like ChatGPT. "Strongly agree" (as a concern/risk)

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI does hallucinate and make mistakes. This is a real concern. "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known issue with AI systems trained on biased data. "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern, especially with data collection and potential breaches. "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is possible if AI recommendations aren't properly evaluated. "Agree"


Now I need to format these responses for the function call.
